snippet: Fighting broke out in Bangui, the capital, just before the United Nations Security Council approved a resolution to expand a force in the country.
lead_paragraph: Fighting broke out in Bangui, the capital, just before the United Nations Security Council approved a resolution to expand a force in the country.
abstract: Fighting tears through parts of Bangui, Central African Republic, hours before the United Nations Security Council votes to strengthen the international force that has been unable to quell the chaos there; officials say some strategic areas appear to have come under sustained assault from forces opposed to the rebel coalition that seized power.

headline.main: Clashes Erupt in Capital of Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: Clashes Erupt in Capital of Central African Republic

byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Dakar, and Somini Sengupta from San Francisco.
byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and SOMINI SENGUPTA
